title: Projectile motion - changing v and theta

content.question: A projectile is launched from level ground at an angle <math alttext="theta, which is less than 45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> above the horizontal. The projectile lands some distance away with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. If both the speed and the angle with which the projectile was launched were doubled, what would the new speed be when it lands?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 v times the sine of theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>v</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
